alert.note: Alert for Greene; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 4:56AM EST until January 13 at 8:15AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Oglethorpe Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Ward Road floods and cuts off access to L.C. Curtis and Son Sand and Gravel Company. Irrigation systems also begin to flood and need to be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EST Friday was 19.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 19.3 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 9.9 feet and begin rising again early Sunday morning. It will rise to 10.0 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.3 feet on 02/20/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM EST.
